ITTIA DB IoT Embedded Database Manual

5.1.1. Microsoft Visual Studio¶

Complete the following steps to add ITTIA DB IoT to a Visual C++ Project:

  1. Open Visual Studio and create a new Win32 Console Application project.
  2. Open the settings for your project from the menu: Project → Properties.
  3. Select All Configurations from the Configuration list.
  4. Select the property page: Configuration Properties → C/C++ → General.
  5. Add $DBDIR\include to the Additional Include Directories property.
  6. Select the property page: Configuration Properties → Linker → General.
  7. Add $DBDIR\lib to the Additional Library Directories property.
  8. Select the property page: Configuration Properties → Linker → Input.
  9. Add ittiadb.lib to the Additional Dependencies property.
  10. Press OK to close the project settings dialog.
  11. Add application source code files to the project. You can use the Time Series storage to help you get started.
  12. Copy ittiadb.dll from $DBDIR\bin to the project directory.
  13. Build and run your application.

In the above steps, replace $DBDIR with the directory where ITTIA DB IoT is installed, including the product and compiler version folders. For example: C:\Program Files\ITTIA DB IoT\8.2.0\msvc2015_64.

For any project that uses the C++ API, follow these additional steps:

  1. Add the project $DBDIR\src\storage.vcxproj to the workspace, using the menu item: File → Add → Existing Project.

  2. Answer Yes when asked whether you should convert and open this project.

  3. Include the storage project as a dependency for your project. Select your project, then go to the menu item: Project → Project Dependencies.

  4. Check storage in the list that is presented and press OK.

  5. Open the settings for your project again and select the property page: Configuration Properties → C++ → Code Generation.

  6. Select Release from the Configuration list. Set the Runtime Library property to Multi-threaded DLL (/MD).

    Note

    This step is necessary because all projects must be compiled using the same runtime library. Alternatively, you can change the Runtime Library setting for the storage project to match the desired setting for your project.

  7. Select Debug from the Configuration list. Set the Runtime Library property to Multi-threaded Debug DLL (/MDd).
